*div1 type="summary"* *p*Samuel C. Hirams to Austin, October 23, 1826. Concerning building.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Sn Jacinto Bay */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="10-23-1826">October 23 1826*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dear Sir*/p*
*p*This will inform you that I have removed to the *location_mentioned*Bay*/location_mentioned*, and am recovering my health verry fast, indeed was my *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*in a situation to leave *location_mentioned*home */location_mentioned*I am able to work now. my little *person_mentioned*Daughter */person_mentioned*has the fever, but she is getting better. My *person_mentioned*wife */person_mentioned*also is mending. I wish you to be perticular in having the flooring plank stackd so that it may dry, and send me word when you think you will be ready for me to gow to work, and as soon as you can get the scantling hauled I can be at work framing untill the shingles and weatherboarding can be furnished. I am anxious to be at it for I want to make a crop in the *date_mentioned n="Spring - 1827">spring */date_mentioned*if I do not meet sufficient incouragement there. I could get a *person_mentioned*man */person_mentioned*here to make your shingles but he will not do it for six dollars, and I will not give no more, for that is a great price*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Saml. C. Hirams*/person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Col S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
